Power plants.Description: Power plants can generate electricity using renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, hydro, or geothermal energy.
Some power plants burn coal to generate electricity, although it is a non-renewable and polluting fuel source.
Certain power plants utilize nuclear power to generate electricity, which is a low-carbon energy source but comes with safety concerns.
Power plants can use natural gas as a fuel source to generate electricity, which is cleaner than coal but still contributes to greenhouse gas emissions.
